intro: Tylophora tenuis var. ovata, commonly known as the slender tylophora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically borne in axillary inflorescences. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. This species is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories.
